abstract: Ray Dalio, the founder of Bridgewater Associates, has some tough questions on why hedge fund returns look so much like returns in the stock market.
snippet: Ray Dalio, the founder of Bridgewater Associates, has some tough questions on why hedge fund returns look so much like returns in the stock market.
lead_paragraph: “We are somewhere between the third and fifth inning in the growth of assets invested in alternative strategies,” said Todd Builione, a managing partner at Highbridge Capital Management, a $34 billion hedge fund that is majority owned by JPMorgan Chase.

headline.main: As Money Pours in, Hedge Funds Come to Look More Like the Markets
headline.print_headline: As Money Pours In, Hedge Funds Come to Look More Like the Markets
